abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome for the Container Transport
            Project for China was satisfactory, the sustainability was
            likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. Lessons learned from the project: In linking
            the development of a business enterprise (container handling
            and transportation) to a reform in government policy
            (Customs regime), it was not foreseen that a change of such
            significance might apply to the trade in general rather than
            just the project enterprises. The business model of the
            Inland Container Depot (ICD) enterprise, which relied
            heavily on the availability of off-port clearance of
            containers, did not take into account the competition that
            could come about when alternative sources for obtaining the
            service became available. The poor performance of the ICD
            Development component highlights the importance of technical
            assistance and the need for measures to mitigate risks when
            a new business is embarked upon by an enterprise with no
            prior experience.

442466.trustfund:
TF035167-CHINA - TA FOR THE CONTAINER
            TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF034590-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF022772-PHRD-CONTAINER TRANSPORT AND TRADE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Container Transport Project aims at
            facilitating inland penetration of seaborne containers from
            gateway ports to inland cities, thus contributing to
            reducing economic disparities between coastal and inland
            areas. There are two main components in this project. First,
            Inland Container Depot (ICD) development aims at developing
            container handling capability at selected inland cities
            located along two pilot corridors. The Bank will finance
            qualified ICDs for their construction and the procurement of
            equipment. Second, upgrading Tianjin Port container handling
            capacity will extend financial assistance to the upgrading
            of container handling equipment at Tianjin Harbor Container
            Company, and providing technical assistance to establish a
            better operational and institutional environment for
            container operations.

438867.trustfund:
TF035167-CHINA - TA FOR THE CONTAINER
            TRANSPORT PROJECT,TF034590-CHINA - TRANSPORTATION,TF022772-PHRD-CONTAINER TRANSPORT AND TRADE

repnme.cdata!:
China - Container Transport Project :
            environmental impact statements of improving international
            container multi-model transportation system

abstracts.cdata!:
The Container Transport Project will
            develop international container depots (ICDs) at eleven
            cities of four provinces, including Tianjin Port, Tangshan,
            Qinhuangdao, Baoding, Shijiazhuang, Cangzhou, Handan,
            Baotou, Xintang, Xiaoshan, and Huzhou. The main source of
            air pollution source comes from tail gas from vehicles. To
            mitigate the impact, all vehicles must run on designated
            route. Trees will be planted along it. Cleaning of
            containers results in water pollution. To mitigate the
            impact, all cleaning wastewater must be massively treated.
            Only the wastewater fitting the national standards may be
            discharged. All rubbish produced in the process of treatment
            must be sent to specific trash collection spots. During
            operation, vegetation belts will be built in all ICDs to
            reduce machine noise and vehicle noise. Layout of each ICD
            will be reasonably planned and designed so that noise
            pollution will be minimized. Vehicle speed will be limited.
            Soundproof walls will be built in some sites. Cargoes at
            some sites contain dangerous substances which may cause
            diffusion of poison, explosion, and fires. These dangerous
            cargoes must be handled by trained personnel. "Temporal
            Regulations on Port Management of Dangerous Cargoes"
            will be strictly enforced.
